Record Class JsonValue

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
com.webfirmframework.wffweb.json.JsonValue
Record Components:
codePoints - the code points of string representation of value.
valueType - the JsonValueType.
All Implemented Interfaces:
JsonPart
public record JsonValue(int[] codePoints, JsonValueType valueType) extends Record implements JsonPart
Since:
12.0.4

  • Constructor Details

    • JsonValue

      public JsonValue(int[] codePoints, JsonValueType valueType)
      Creates an instance of a JsonValue record class.
      Parameters:
      codePoints - the value for the codePoints record component
      valueType - the value for the valueType record component

    • JsonValue

      public JsonValue(String value, JsonValueType valueType)
      Parameters:
      value - the value as a string. If the value type is a BOOLEAN or NUMBER, it should not contain whitespaces. If the value type is NULL, it should be null.
      valueType - the json type of value.
      Since:
      12.0.4

    • JsonValue

      public JsonValue()
      For null value and NULL type.
      Since:
      12.0.4

      The value type will be STRING.
      Parameters:
      value - the json string value.
      Since:
      12.0.4

    • JsonValue

      public JsonValue(Number value)
      The value type will be NUMBER.
      Parameters:
      value - the number value.
      Since:
      12.0.4

    • JsonValue

      public JsonValue(boolean value)
      The value type will be BOOLEAN.
      Parameters:
      value - the boolean value.
      Since:
      12.0.4

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object).
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
